result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A McGeshick Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: fron defense attorney to Judge requesting funeral leave
Order for furlough signed by Judge Habeck

Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:01 AM. Called 16CF40, 16CF104, 16CF107 and 16CM09. State - all matters resolved and here for change of plea - 16CF40 will be dismissed and read in in its entirely; 16CF107 - plead g/nc to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, remaining counts (#2, #4 and #5) to be DRI with a joint recommendation of 30 days jail on each count concrrent to each other and court costs; 16CM09 - plead g/nc to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, #2 - DRI, both parties are free to argue; 16CF104 - amend counts #1 and #2 to 961.41(3g)(am) - class I felony for possessiing schedule I or II narcotic. #3 - DRI, State recommends 3 years probation under counts #1 and #2 and arguing for 365 days conditional jail time on count #1 with other conditions of: AODA, costs, $420.00 reimbursement to Forest County Drug Task Force, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars , taverns or similar establishments, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by treating physican or medical provider, no contact or affiliation with Kaylynn Samplaski, attend at least one self help program per week and provide proof of attendance to P&P agent - defense is free to argue the jail term on count #1. Voorhees and McGeshick agree and has provided signed plea questionnaire to the Court. Court - 16CF40 - dismisses and reads in all counts, 16CF104 - amends #1 and #2 to possession of schedule I or II narcotic contrary to 941.61(3g)(am) - reads new charge and penalty. McGeshick pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as amended on 16CF104. Court dismisses and reads in count 3 on 16CF104. Court - 16CF107 - McGeshick pleads G to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, Court DRI counts #2, #4 and #5. 16CM09 - McGeshick pleads G to count #1 and #3 as alleged. Voorhees believes that the repeater enhancement on count #3 of 16CM09 was to be dismissed. State has no objections to that after discussion. Court amends count #3 to delete the repeater allegation. McGeshick pleads G to amended count #3. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation on 16CF107, asks for 365 days conditional jail for count #1 on 16CF104, argues on 16CM09 for 30 days jail on each count concurrent to each other but consecutive to jail time on 16CF107. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing - 48 days credit on 16CM09, 5 days credit on 16CF107, asks Court to follow recommendations that have been made, 16CF104 - asks for probation only on that matter and no jail time or something as deemed appropriate by the Court. McGeshick makes statement, remorseful. Court tries to clarify credit, 16CF107 and 16CF104 - (May 9 - May 16, 2016 - stipulated - 7 days), 16CM09 (1/26/16 - 3/14/16 including treatment time on ATR otherwise 1/26/16 - 2/11/16) , Court will not give him credit for time in treatment but will give him credit from 1/26/16 to 2/11/16 - 17 days. State informs Court that the plea offer has not changed from when it was denied except for the free to argue portion. Voorhees responds in regards to plea offer. State informs Court that it did decide to DRI 16CF40. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CF107 - count #1 - 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time and community service allowed under 973.03(3) - credit for 7 days, count #3 - 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time and community service - concurrent to count #1, costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO; 16CM09 - counts #1 and #3 - 30 days in FC jail - concurrent to each other but consecutive to jail time in 16CF107 - huber and good time and community service allowed - credit for 17 days, costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO; 16CF104 - counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence on each count and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other but consecutive to jail time on 16CM09 and 16CF107 - with conditions on each case of: costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, reimburse cost of $420.00 to Forest County Drug Task Force - paid thru probation, maintian/obtain full time school/employment, #2 - 200 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, no contact with Kaylynn Samplaski, must attend at least one AA/NA or similar treatment program and provide proof of attendance to P&P agent, count #1 - 1 year in FC jail - huber and community service under 973.09(7m) - report to jail today, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal. Voorhees asks Court to clarifiy credit on 16CM09. Court clarifies jail credit given on 16CM09 - did give credit for 17 days (1/26/16 - 2/11/16). Adjourned at 10:05 AM.
State
Jury trial on August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:52 PM. Called 15CM189, 16CM09, 16CF40, 16CF104, 16CF107. Voorhees is ready to proceed with PH on 16CF104 and 16CF107. Court sets the matters that were set for FPT today for JT as the matters are not resolved. State - offer was on 15CM189 - amend one count to county ordinance of DC with $300 fine plus costs. McGeshick is willing to take that deal. Court amends only count to county ordinance of DC with $300.00 fine plus costs totalling $582.50, pleads G, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - take bond posted - remainder due 60 days after release from custody/CO. State - 16CM09 - plead to count #1 and #3 as alleged and #2 DRI, free to argue for sentence. Voorhees and McGeshick agree and state that they will accept that resolvement. State - 16CF40  - plead G to counts #1 and #3, counts #2 and #4 to be DRI, both parties are free to argue and have received a request for further discovery on this case. Court will set this case for JT on 8/11/16. State - proceed with PH on 16CF107 - State calls Officer Darrel Wilson. State offers exhibit #1. Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (3:00 PM). Officer Wilson sworn in at 3:00 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Voorhees at 3:03 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained. Wilson excused. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Voorhees has Information, waives further reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pelas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT on 8/11/16 at 9:00 AM. State - 16CF104 - State calls Detective Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 3:06 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (3:11 PM). Cross exam by Voorhees at 3:15 PM. State objects - sustained (3:25 PM). Ashbeck excused at 3:25 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Voorhees has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT on 8/11/16 at 9:00 AM. Also set 16CM9 for JT on 8/11/16 but Voorhees can bring it back whenever if he takes the deal.
Demand for Supplemental Discovery - defense
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:18 PM. Called 16CF40, 15CM189 & 16CM09. Voorhees does not have all discovery, also requested transcript in case 16CF40. The 15CM189 and 16CM09 could be resolved today. State indicates 16CF40 full discovery has not be completed and sent to Voorhees at this time. State feels the 15CM189 & 16CM09 could be resolved today. Voorhees asks for another FPT date. Court advises of options to get all cases resolved. Voorhees still would like to adjourn. Court will adjourn.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
state
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. Follow after care program from Koinonia.
to signature bond

Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:48 PM. Called 16CM09, 15CM189 & 16CF40. State - here for PH on 16CF40. 16CM09 - Voorhees has went over complaint with McGeshick, but does not have copy, court goes over charges and penalties with defendant. McGeshick understands. Voorhees waives further reading and enters NG pleas to all counts. 15CM189 to tag along with other cases. 16CF40 - State calls Joshua Peterson as witness, sworn in, 3:52 PM. Court advises of 5th amendment rights due to criminal liability. State directs, 3:54 PM. Identification of defendant, 3:58 PM. Voorhees cross-examines, 3:59 PM. State objects - over ruled, 4:04 PM. State objection - sustained, 4:06 PM. State objection - sustained, 4:07 PM. Voorhees asks for sequestration of any other witnesses. State calls Markie Szprejda-Christensen, sworn in, 4:09 PM. Court advises of 5th amendment rights. State directs, 4:10 PM. Witness had identified defendant, 4:15 PM. Voorhees cross-examines, 4:16 PM. State objects - over ruled, 4:20 PM. State objection - sustained, 4:20 PM. State calls Steven Ashbeck as witness, sworn in, 4:21 PM. State directs. Voorhees cross examines, 4:23 PM. State objects - over ruled, 4:27 PM. State objects - sustained, 4:28 PM. Witness excused, 4:28 PM. State is ready to file INFO, just needs to change time on information. Voorhees motions to dismiss 4 counts due to state failing to prove probable cause for stated reasons. State makes argument in regards to motion and asks court to deny motion. Court - denies motion, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State will file INFO with anticipation of an amended information with correct date. Voorhees waives further reading and enters NG pleas on all counts. Court accepts pleas. Voorhees asks for amendment of bond. Court - will amend all bonds to a signature bond, in the amount that warrants were issued for. No consumption of alcohol and follow after care program from Koinonia.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Alternative to Revocation Agreement - 13CF164
Preliminary hearing at 03-14-2016 01:00 pm
Release from custody for the purpose of attending inpatient treatment upon an available bed and return to FOSO upon completion of treatment, no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CF40 and 15CM189. Called at 4:07 PM. Voorhees and McGeshick have both complaints, waives reading of both complaints, requests PH on 16CF40 and asks that the CM case track, will enter NG pleas to those counts on 15CM189, will waive time limits for PH but would like to address bail. Voorhees - defendant has entered into an ATR and will start that tomorrow, asks court to modify bond to allow the defendant participation in treatment, stipulated by State (agreed) but asking that cash bond continue upon completion of treatment. Court - bond - continues bond but release from custody for the purpose of attending inpatient treatment upon an available bed and return to FOSO upon completion of treatment, sets for PH on 3/14/16 at 1:00 PM and set CM case for STC on same date and time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-10-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Jeffrey A McGeshick in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 15CM189. Called at 10:55 AM. State - here for INIT on CF and RWIN on CM case. McGeshick has both complaints. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney for each case. McGeshick understands all charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own, makes statement in regards to bond (wants to enter into treatment). State - bond - wants bond to continue as previously set on CF file ($3,000.00 cash). Court - 15CM189 - $300 cash (already posted) and court continues bond on CF case but will consider request for further consideration. Court sets both matters for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol.
$3000 cash set
